_header: All haste is odious whereas discretion
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 115.
_description: John Lydgate, Verses against Haste — twenty 8-line stanzas with refrain

BodRawC86.First Lines:
All hast is odious wher as discreciounOf wilfulnesse hath non
                    interesse…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…Hast in all perill to crystes passiounEnbrace þat baner
                    and do þer on A byde

CULKk16.First Lines:
Alle haste is odious where as discressionOff wylfulnesse hath non
                    intresse…
CULKk16.Last Lines:
…Haste in all perylys to Cristus PassiounEnbrace þat
                    Baner & do þer by a byde
CULKk16.Attributed Title:
Here…be gyneth the dite on þis worde / He hasteth weel þat
                    wysely can a byde (f. 205v)
CULKk16.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 759-64.

BLHar78.First Lines:
All hast ys edyns where as dystrecyounof wylfulnes hath non
                    encrese…
BLHar78.Last Lines:
…hast in all perelles to cryst Ihesu ys passyounEnbras there
                    thy banner & loke there thou abyde

BLHar2251.First Lines:
The hasty man failith neuer wooHast contrarious enmy to
                    sadnes…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…hast in al pile vnto cristes passounEnbrace þat banner
                    and þeron abyde
